TopicTitle: Can MechJeb work out a Geostationary orbit height?

Articles.Content:
As the title states can it work out orbit radius and does anyone know the orbit radius for Kerbin orbit?

Edited August 15, 2013 by Sochin

KSP Wiki: Synchronous orbit: 2868.75 km.

But it's not so much the apoapsis and periapsis that have to be exact to be in a synchronous orbit, but the orbit's semi-major axis.

mechjeb wont work out geostationary orbits it only puts you into the orbit you tell it to.

For a geostationary orbit around kerbin set your orbital altitude to 2868.75 km, just look on the wiki if you want planet info http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Kerbin
Thanks for that I am still gettin gused to how the wiki works.
